_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Six qualities that prevent someone from: They don’t want to listen when the teaching and practice proclaimed by the Realized One is being taught.
They don’t lend an ear or apply their mind to understand them.
They learn the incorrect meaning and reject the correct meaning.
They accept views that contradict the teaching.
Six qualities that enable someone to ent: They want to listen when the teaching and practice proclaimed by the Realized One is being taught.
They lend an ear and apply their mind to understand them.
They learn the correct meaning and reject the incorrect meaning.
They accept views that agree with the teaching.
